Description: Ostracon (?), fragment of the upper-body of a buff-coloured pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse, the exterior, the lower section of which is ribbed, is covered with a self-slip and remains of one line of red-painted cursive text.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394876) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394876)
